title: Marcelo wishes Neymar happy birthday before Cristiano Ronaldo and hits back at fans who accuse him of favouritism
text:
EFL 'shut the f*** up' Marcelo wishes Neymar happy birthday before Cristiano Ronaldo and hits back at fans who accuse him of favouritism 
Brazilian full-back lashed out at supporters on Instagram after he was accused of snubbing his Real Madrid team-mate By TOBY GANNON Comments MARCELO has lashed out in fury at online trolls accusing him of favouring Neymar over Cristiano Ronaldo. 
The Brazil full-back wished his compatriot and Barcelona rival happy birthday on Instagram – minutes BEFORE he did the same to Ronaldo. Instagram 7 Marcelo furiously hit back at fans after they accused him of snubbing Cristiano Ronaldo on his birthday 
Fans called Marcelo “rude” and demanded to know why he had not sent his wishes to his club team-mate first. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest football news, gossip and rumours 
Marcelo responded: “Shut the f*** up idiots.” 
Brazilian duo Marcelo and Neymar, now 25, get on famously having played together on the national team for the last six years. Neymar’s stunning ex rumoured to have found love again - with Turkish 'arms dealer who sells missile systems' 
The defender also has a good relationship with Ronaldo, who he has supported on Real’s left flank since 2009. 
Ronaldo, who turned 32 on Sunday, had been on the receiving end of Los Blancos’ boo boys last week during their 3-0 win over Real Sociedad. 
Frustrated fans took their anger out on the Portuguese superstar in the 23rd minute when he lost the ball. Getty Images Cristiano Ronaldo is booed by Real Madrid fans during their 3-0 win over Real Sociedad Getty Images Cristiano Ronaldo and Marcelo have a good relationship from their time together at Real Madrid Getty Images Real Madrid star Marcelo and Barcelona ace Neymar bury their club allegiances when on Brazil duty Getty Images 7 Marcelo and Neymar get along famously while on Brazil duty 
Ronaldo was calmed down at full-time though, with Marca reporting Real president Florentino Perez met with him to reassure him of the club’s backing. 
The forward recognises he receives the flak when things go wrong, but does not understand why. Even in training Real Madrid star Cristiano Ronaldo scores some amazing goals!
